item.title: Heather add a quote by Howard Ikemoto
item.description: "When my daughter was about seven years old, she asked me one day what I did at work. I told her I worked at the college - that my job was to teach people how to draw. She stared at me, incredulous, and said, "You mean they forget?" -- Howard Ikemoto

item.title: Heather add a quote by Alice Roosevelt Longworth
item.description: "If you haven't got anything nice to say about anybody come sit next to me." -- Alice Roosevelt Longworth

item.title: Heather add a quote by Jeff Goines
item.description: "The really hard part isn't stepping off the boat; it's learning how to swim." -- Jeff Goines

item.title: Heather add a quote by Heather Ormsby
item.description: "We are the observers, and our writing makes us witnesses to what we have seen and learned about the human condition." -- Heather Ormsby

item.title: Heather add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Heather add a quote by Paul Cézanne
item.description: "The day is coming when a single carrot, freshly observed, will set off a revolution." -- Paul Cézanne

item.title: Heather add a quote by Wittgenstein Ludwig
item.description: "If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present." -- Wittgenstein Ludwig
